“Oh, my pretty baby. There’s nothing I’d love more than to do just that. But you gotta come down f’me yeah? Can’t have yeh this far away from me on such a special occasion. Wanna share every moment with yeh.” He smiled releasing her pert nipple from his mouth with a wet pop. She simply nods and nuzzles her head in his neck sucking a love bite to the surface.

Picking her up by her waist as she kept her legs wrapped around his hips, he made the short journey down the corridor to his bedroom. As he laid her on the bed he attempted to coax her down from the clouds a little — even if it was just the tiniest bit. He wanted his girl to remember every second of this special time in their relationship. Yes, he absolutely adores his baby love, without a doubt. But it was Y/N he fell for first. That day she’d practically fell into his lap when she burst through the doors of the law seminar he was covering as part of his Masters degree. She was a meek, shy 19 year old this time last year. She barely spoke two words to anyone who wasn’t her mother or her best friend. And now? Now here she was begging Harry to take her virginity on the eve of their first anniversary as a real couple, and fuck, he was such a lucky man. No girl he had ever had in the past could compare to her. His Y/N. His baby love. She was shy, but also loved to explore her kinky side. And he loved that.

summary: PT 3 TO ASSHOKE HARRY AND YN BEING THE LEAST FAVE IS ALL I️ NEED MY HEART ACHES
question: PT 3 TO ASSHOKE HARRY AND YN BEING THE LEAST FAVE IS ALL I️ NEED MY HEART ACHES
answer:
y/n wouldn’t even know how to react on harry’s hand on her waist and she just stares at it, doesn’t even look at him and he feels dejected by that, suddenly not wanting his pants to get straightened even if he wanted that five minutes ago.

“nothing.”

“i don’t believe you.”

harry’s persistent to get to know why you’re acting like this, much more on why you’re disconnecting yourself from your whole group and even more from him, the fact that this is your job and that he suddenly doesn’t want to see you doing it without talking to him.

“then don’t ask.”

he’s retorted with the answer and it’s soft coming out of your lips, eyebrows having the illusion of meeting in the middle because of the crease it’s in and harry’s lips are pressed tightly, your hands just having a mind of their own as you’re already doing the finishing touches harry l. does and trusted you in doing so more than you could ever imagine.

he can’t believe you’re this close to him yet he still can’t feel the warmth you used to give him unknowingly, and he feels cold even with the thick sleeves of his suit and the flared pants.

“m’gonna still ask because you’re not okay.”

“then don’t ask because you already know the answer to yourself.”

he still isn’t being spared with a glance by you, your hand gripping his stylist’s phone and swipes it to take the picture for him and while you’re instructing him to just stand straight, he can’t bring himself to.

not because his neck’s aching from taking a nap on the couch awhile ago in hopes that you’d be there on your phone beside him because that’s your spot.

it’s because you’re cold to him and he can’t take it anymore.

“why’re you being so distant with me?”

“figured you wouldn’t want your least favorite crew member chasing your tail all the time.”

the angry mumble passes through his ears and it makes his blood run cold, fingers just wrapping around your wrist that’s about to snap at him when he doesn’t let go.

“no, no — it’s not, s’not-…”

“what, tell me that it’s not like that?”

you finally snap at him and it’s the time your voice has been the loudest he’s heard since the past few days, eyes just burning holes at him and it makes him stammer.

the words did hurt one of his crew members, and he didn’t even know that she went to bed with the intention to sleep, and she couldn’t, and it’s all because of his words that he said behind your back, and made full circle to just rest in your heart for the rest of the remaining days.

“if you’re gonna be an asshole, harry, atleast have the decency to do it right in front of m’face.”

title: The Daily Anna- Chapter 3
body:
I’m sorry that this took so long, life took over for a little while, but I’m hoping to have the next one out reasonably soon, before time gets away from me again. Let me know your thoughts on this chapter and what you think might happen next. 

Master Post 

April 17th.

My First Date Tips

  1. BE     YOURSELF!

This is important. If you have to change yourself to impress the person you’re on  a date with then they’re not the right person to be dating. Don’t pretend to like music you don’t, or shy away from sharing your interests because you’re afraid they won’t like them. If you have to pretend to be someone you’re not on the first date, the second and third probably aren’t going to go so well.

2.              Wear what makes you feel your best.

If that means wearing shorts and a t-shirt then that’s what it means, if you feel confident in what you’re wearing, then you’ll feel more confident in general. Wear something that’s appropriate for what you’re doing, and if you’re as clumsy as I am, don’t wear heels, unless you want to fall flat on your face and embarrass yourself in front of your date.

3.              Don’t use your phone the whole time

If you’re going to be staring at your phone the whole time you might as well be at home. Look up, make conversation, go back to your online life when you get home.

4.              Relax

This isn’t a job interview, your date is probably just as nervous, take a few deep breaths and relax into yourself. It’s natural to feel feel nervous but just remember not to put too much pressure on yourself, this is a first date, if you don’t like them you can leave, it’s not the end of the world.

5.              Don’t force it

If it’s not meant to be, it’s not meant to be. Go in with a positive attitude, this could be the love of your life, but they also might not be. Don’t go in thinking it’s going to be terrible, but don’t put too much pressure on you or your date, take it one step at a time, focus on the date and try to enjoy yourself, but if you don’t, it’s no big deal. There are plenty of other fish in the sea.

That dating game is brutal, I’ve been on my fair share of first dates over the years, some of them wonderful, some of them horrible, all of them learning experiences, but watch me ignore all of my own advice when I go on a date tonight. Wish me luck!

Anna. x

***

Anna’s hands were shaking as she sat in the back of the car that Harry had sent for her. She didn’t know where she was going, but she hoped it wasn’t to some fancy restaurant…  She found dinner dates awkward and stuffy and that was the last thing she wanted for her first date with Harry.  

London sped by and Anna watched as her favourite places blurred in the rearview mirror and wondered where she could possibly be going. She knew Harry wanted to keep things quiet for now, which she totally understood, she knew how mean his fans could be to girls that he was  seen with, but part of her felt like maybe it had something to do with Camille.

The car pulled up outside what Anna assumed was Harry’s house and the driver shut the engine off and stepped outside to open the door for Harry.

“Thanks Howard,” Harry said to the driver as the he closed the door behind him. “Hello love,” he took Anna’s hand and placed a gentle kiss on her knuckles.

“Hi” She blushed.

The car pulled away from the house and Anna kept her eyes fixed upon Harry.

“So, where are we going?” she asked, nerves evident in her voice.

“Well” he smirked, placing his hand over hers “ I might have hired out the sky garden for the night”

“You what?” Anna’s jaw dropped. Sky Garden had always been one Anna’s favourite places to go when she had time to kill in london. By day it was a public park and by night it was a rooftop event space but when she had looked into hiring it out for her birthday last year she was immediately turned off by the excessive holding fee and she couldn’t believe that Harry would spend that much on the first date.

“The sky garden” Harry smiled

Anna threw her head back onto the head rest and laughed “How did you manage that? It’s a Tuesday”

“I made friends with the restaurant manager a few years ago”

“So when you say you hired out the Sky Garden, you mean it’s just us there?”

“Not quite” he shook his head “It’s open to members only, but Rick said it will be quiet because it’s a Tuesday”

“And most people have real jobs” Anna added, smiling at Harry.

“How’s the blog going?” Harry turned in his seat so the he was facing Anna.

“I’ve spent the entire day in meetings about which font I should use for the header”

He began nodding his head “You’re fonting, that’s the worst kind of admin”

“I never thought I would care so much about a font”  She giggled

“Neither did I, took me a month to decide”

“That might just be a world record” She nodded genuinely impressed by his dedication to his aesthetic.

The drive from Harry’s place to Sky Garden took them about half an hour and the conversation remained light hearted the entire way but Anna couldn’t shake off the conversation she’d had with Ronnie a few days ago. It felt like the elephant in the room, and she wondered if he’d read her blog post and if he was feeling it too.  

Silence followed them through the elevator ride to the 36th floor of the walkie talkie building and into the beautiful rooftop garden. As they stepped out of the lift Harry grabbed onto Anna’s hand intertwining his fingers with hers and lead her towards the bar. Anna had never been there at this time of the day before, it was usually around midday when she came in, but right now the sun was setting over the London skyline and the room was illuminated in an orange glow.

“So do you take all your dates here?” Anna asked as they waited for the bartender

“No” Harry shook his head “been a while since I’ve been on a date”

Now Anna knew he was lying and she felt her heart sink. She knew he’d been on dates recently, she’d seen it in the papers and she couldn’t figure out why he would lie about that.

The bartender approached them and she was glad that she had an excuse to ignore his comments.

“Harry! Long time no see” he offered his hand for Harry to shake “what can I get for you?”

“Tequila on the rocks for me” he smiled and turned to Anna “what about you love?”

“Uhh” Anna thought for second “I’ll go a white wine”

“Pinot Grigio?” he asked her as he pulled a bottle from the fridge

“Please” she smiled and watched as he walked away to prepare their drinks.

“You don’t believe everything you read about me do you?” Harry asked her, sensing that she hadn’t liked his comment about dating.

“No” she shook her head “but I do believe what your crew members told me”

He nodded his head “Everybody has secrets right” he took his first sip of his drink that the bartender had just handed to him.

“So you read it then” there was a tone of bitterness in her voice.

“I’m not keeping anything from you Anna” his voice was soft and sincere but she was still having trouble believing him.

“Camille” she said sharply as she took a sip of her wine.

“Ahh” he sighed and turned around, grabbing onto her hand again “that I can explain, but let’s go sit down”

Anna followed him, trying to keep a positive attitude about this whole thing because she really wanted there to be a second date. He lead them to the couches in the corner of the room, that overlooked the skyline.

“Camille” he said as he sat down next to her “Isn’t my girlfriend, despite what everyone would like to believe, we went on one date last year, it didn’t work out, but we stayed friends”

“But she went on tour with you?” Anna was more confused than ever now

“It was a friendship with a few benefits, but it’s over now”

“Over?”

“No more benefits” Harry nodded “She wanted more and I didn’t so it only made sense to stop so that no one gets hurt”

“I’m sorry I thought you were keeping something from me”

“Don’t be “ Harry shook his head “I would have thought the same”

Anna breathed a sigh of relief. She didn’t want to believe that Harry would ever cheat on someone, but before now all the evidence was pointing towards that.

“I didn’t think you were that guy” Anna said

“I’m not” he smiled.

The conversation ended there, Anna didn’t want to ask any more questions about it, she trusted his word and she knew if he wanted to tell her more about it, he would. She took a sip of her wine and sat back in her chair, fixing her eyes on the view.

The rest of the night was filled with almosts, almost hugs, almost kisses, a lot of stolen glances and some laughter.The kind of laughter that made them cry and every time Harry would wipe the tears away from Anna’s eyes with a gentle touch . They were both treading lightly, Harry hadn’t liked a girl this much in a long time and Anna was still damaged from her last relationship. Dating again felt strange for both of them, Anna wasn’t sure she was ready to give herself to another person but getting along with Harry felt easy. She didn’t have to worry about what she looked like when she laughed, or if her hair still looked like it did when she left the house. She was comfortable and that scared her.

As the night was drawing to a close, Harry wrapped his arms around her and it turned from a night of almosts to a night of possibilities as she relaxed into his touch. The ride home didn’t seem to take as long, Anna was much more comfortable and Harry was too.  They were snuggled into each other in the back seat of the car driven by Harry’s personal driver remaining quiet, content in the other’s company.

“Comfortable silence is overrated” Anna whispered with a grin spread across her face

“Finally” Harry sighed “someone who agrees with me” and with that, he leant down and hovered his lips over hers and she was drawn in by the simple gesture caressing his lips with hers reaching her hand up to cup his face. The smell of his cologne was overpowering but in that moment Anna didn’t care, warmth flooded her as she leaned into his silken lips. They could have kissed all night, but they stopped as the car pulled up outside Anna’s flat.

“Thanks for a great night Harry” she smiled as she opened the car door

His hand was still rested on top of hers and he squeezed it gently before he started to speak “I’ll walk you inside love”

“No” Anna said as she brushed her lips against his again “if you get that far I won’t let you leave and that would be breaking my rule”

He nodded, catching her drift but placed another kiss on her lips anyway “well thank you for giving me a chance”

“How could I not?” she giggled and leant in one last time, kissing him more passionately this time

“You better go before you break your rule” he chuckled and snaked his hand around her back, opening the door for her.

“Good night Styles” she said softly as she stepped out into the brisk air.

April 25th

“Anna, answer the bloody door.”

Anna stirred on the couch, not realising that she’d fallen asleep. Batting her eyelids she sat up abruptly and stretched her arms out wide, adjusting to dimming afternoon light in her apartment.

Ronnie knocked loudly on the door again. He hadn’t heard from her for a few days, which was unusual for her, normally she would send him about six texts a day but he was lucky if he got a one word response and he was worried about her.

“I’m coming” she called as she stood up “Chill.” She made her way to the door, throwing on a jumper to make herself look a little more presentable.

“What’s up Ron?”

He didn’t answer her, instead he wrapped his arms around her as if it had been months since they’d seen each other.

“I thought you were dead” he said with his head still resting on her shoulder.

“Nope” Anna giggled “Still living, I’ve just been crazy busy”

“Too busy for your best friend ay?” He was joking, Anna could tell by the tone in his voice and truth be told she had missed him.

“Never, come in, I was about to make dinner” she lied, if Ronnie didn’t knock on her door she would still be sleeping and if she was honest she didn’t even really know what the time was, but she guessed it was around 8 judging by the fading light outside.

“Mmm, what are we having?” he followed her through to the kitchen and watched as she opened the fridge which was looking mostly empty, except for a few old vegetables and a bottle of wine.

“Pizza?” Anna said closing the fridge “I haven’t had the chance to go shopping for a while”

“I can see that” Ronnie said holding up a banana that was so old it was almost black “Pizza sounds great if it means I don’t have to eat this”

“Oh come on, that would make a great banana bread”

“Yeah if it doesn’t kill you first” he put it back where he got it from and searched the drawer where Anna kept her take out menus. They ordered from their favourite restaurant and sat down with a glass of wine each, ready to catch up on what they’d missed over the last few days. Anna cleared away all the images she had lying on her dining table. Her blog was getting revamped and she had to choose the layout, which meant that she’d spent the last few days staring at different concepts.

“Geez he’s keen” Ronnie said about five minutes after they sat down as he watched Anna’s phone light up with about seven messages from Harry within the span of a minute. Anna blushed and picked her phone up.

Morning love

I know it’s not morning for you

But it’s morning here

Well kinda

It’s 4am

Time zones are weird

How are you?

“He’s in Australia” She said putting down the phone and making a mental note to reply soon.

“How did the date go?” Ronnie asked, a tone of bitterness evident in his voice.

Anna had made a point of not telling Ronnie about it, as much as she loved him, after her last relationship ended badly he got too involved in her dating life and usually scared them off.

“Well, he’s still talking to me more than a week later from the other side of the world, so I think it went ok”

“Did you kiss him? Did you fuck him? What about the other girl?” Ronnie had a habit of asking invasive questions all at once to play it off as a bit of fun, but Anna knew what he was doing.

“Ron” Anna sighed “You’re prying again”

“Answer my questions and I’ll change the subject”

“We didn’t have sex, it was the first date, you know I don’t do that” She was annoyed that he would even ask her that.

“Except for that one time that you did” Ronnie took a sip of his wine and a smug smile stretched across his face.

“That was different, I knew him well before that” She wasn’t lying. Anna had had sex with one guy on the first date, actually, she wouldn’t even call it a date, they both knew how it was going to end, it wasn’t long after she’d broken up with her dickhead of an ex boyfriend who cheated on her for months before she found out and it was a friend of hers so as far as she was concerned it didn’t count as sex on the first date, more like a friend helping out a friend.

“Ok but this is Harry Styles so maybe your standards slipped”

“If anything they’re higher, Don’t want him to think I’m easy”

“So did you kiss him then?”

“He kissed me, once, when he dropped me home” she lied again, there was more than one kiss, but Ronnie didn’t need to know that.

Ronnie nodded, holding himself back from making any comments “And the girlfriend?”

“They were friends with benefits, he says it’s over now”

“Good.”

The conversation died and Anna picked up her phone to reply to Harry, not wanting to wait  too long.

Good evening

I’m tired if I’m honest, had a long day

How are you? Got a show today?

Ronnie didn’t try to make more conversation he simply sat on Anna’s couch sipping his wine, waiting for the pizza to arrive and when it did, he was the first to make a move to answer the door.

“What’s going on with you Ron?” Anna broke the silence “any ladies?”

“You know I don’t date “ He said bluntly taking his first bite of pizza

“Alright, sorry” She rolled her eyes and picked up her buzzing phone again

Not today, making my way to Sydney for tomorrow’s show.

What’s been keeping you so busy?

Just work, revamping the blog takes time

Sydney sounds fun, I’ve always wanted to go there

The harbour’s nice, but I can’t say I’ve seen much of the city otherwise, I don’t get to go out much

I have a question for you

I might have an answer

I know it’s a lot to ask so if you don’t want to I’ll totally understand

But I really like you Anna and I want to spend more time with you, so, I was wondering if you wanted to come on tour with me in the US?

Anna read Harry’s last message and her jaw dropped causing Ronnie to look up from his own phone.

“What did he say?” he was suddenly interested again.

“He..he” Anna couldn’t quite comprehend what she’d just been asked

“He what, spit it out An”

“He wants me to go on tour with him”

Ronnie’s nostrils flared and he gently placed his plate full of pizza down on the coffee table “Anna you can’t, you just met the dude”

“It does feel sudden” she admitted, although there wasn’t a bone in her body that didn’t want to start packing her bags already.

“Sudden!” Ronnie exclaimed “it’s mental, you’ve been on one date”

“It’s not like I’d be travelling with just him, you saw how big his crew is”

“Yeah, because he travels with the sound guys” he said sarcastically “don’t be daft Anna, there’s no way he goes around with the crew, he’d be on private jets while they’re in economy”

“Look I don’t know if he does that or not, but it’s beside the point. I’ve got nothing to lose at this point Ronnie, if I go with him and it works out then great, but if it doesn’t then fine, at least I’ll have interesting content for my blog”

“Whatever Anna” he said standing up from his seat and making his way towards the door “but don’t ignore me for months and expect me to pick up the pieces when he breaks your heart” he slammed the door shut and left Anna standing there in silence. She was used to this from Ronnie, he overreacted all the time he would calm down by tomorrow morning and send her an apologetic message followed by a request to pick up his jacket on his way home from work. If she had even the slightest doubts about going on tour with Harry what Ronnie had just said would have been enough to convince her not to go. But she had no doubts, sure, she had only been on one date with him, but she had a good feeling about it and he wouldn’t have asked if he didn’t want her there. So, she picked up her phone again and took a deep breath as she replied to Harry’s message.

I’d love to. x.

I’m sorry that this took so long, life took over for a little while, but I’m hoping to have the next one out reasonably soon, before time gets away from me again. Let me know your thoughts on this chapter and what you think might happen next. 

Master Post 

April 17th.

My First Date Tips

  1. BE     YOURSELF!

This is important. If you have to change yourself to impress the person you’re on  a date with then they’re not the right person to be dating. Don’t pretend to like music you don’t, or shy away from sharing your interests because you’re afraid they won’t like them. If you have to pretend to be someone you’re not on the first date, the second and third probably aren’t going to go so well.

2.              Wear what makes you feel your best.

If that means wearing shorts and a t-shirt then that’s what it means, if you feel confident in what you’re wearing, then you’ll feel more confident in general. Wear something that’s appropriate for what you’re doing, and if you’re as clumsy as I am, don’t wear heels, unless you want to fall flat on your face and embarrass yourself in front of your date.

3.              Don’t use your phone the whole time

If you’re going to be staring at your phone the whole time you might as well be at home. Look up, make conversation, go back to your online life when you get home.

4.              Relax

This isn’t a job interview, your date is probably just as nervous, take a few deep breaths and relax into yourself. It’s natural to feel feel nervous but just remember not to put too much pressure on yourself, this is a first date, if you don’t like them you can leave, it’s not the end of the world.

5.              Don’t force it

If it’s not meant to be, it’s not meant to be. Go in with a positive attitude, this could be the love of your life, but they also might not be. Don’t go in thinking it’s going to be terrible, but don’t put too much pressure on you or your date, take it one step at a time, focus on the date and try to enjoy yourself, but if you don’t, it’s no big deal. There are plenty of other fish in the sea.

That dating game is brutal, I’ve been on my fair share of first dates over the years, some of them wonderful, some of them horrible, all of them learning experiences, but watch me ignore all of my own advice when I go on a date tonight. Wish me luck!

Anna. x

Anna’s hands were shaking as she sat in the back of the car that Harry had sent for her. She didn’t know where she was going, but she hoped it wasn’t to some fancy restaurant…  She found dinner dates awkward and stuffy and that was the last thing she wanted for her first date with Harry.  

London sped by and Anna watched as her favourite places blurred in the rearview mirror and wondered where she could possibly be going. She knew Harry wanted to keep things quiet for now, which she totally understood, she knew how mean his fans could be to girls that he was  seen with, but part of her felt like maybe it had something to do with Camille.

The car pulled up outside what Anna assumed was Harry’s house and the driver shut the engine off and stepped outside to open the door for Harry.

“Thanks Howard,” Harry said to the driver as the he closed the door behind him. “Hello love,” he took Anna’s hand and placed a gentle kiss on her knuckles.

“Hi” She blushed.

The car pulled away from the house and Anna kept her eyes fixed upon Harry.

“So, where are we going?” she asked, nerves evident in her voice.

“Well” he smirked, placing his hand over hers “ I might have hired out the sky garden for the night”

“You what?” Anna’s jaw dropped. Sky Garden had always been one Anna’s favourite places to go when she had time to kill in london. By day it was a public park and by night it was a rooftop event space but when she had looked into hiring it out for her birthday last year she was immediately turned off by the excessive holding fee and she couldn’t believe that Harry would spend that much on the first date.

“The sky garden” Harry smiled

Anna threw her head back onto the head rest and laughed “How did you manage that? It’s a Tuesday”

“I made friends with the restaurant manager a few years ago”

“So when you say you hired out the Sky Garden, you mean it’s just us there?”

“Not quite” he shook his head “It’s open to members only, but Rick said it will be quiet because it’s a Tuesday”

“And most people have real jobs” Anna added, smiling at Harry.

“How’s the blog going?” Harry turned in his seat so the he was facing Anna.

“I’ve spent the entire day in meetings about which font I should use for the header”

He began nodding his head “You’re fonting, that’s the worst kind of admin”

“I never thought I would care so much about a font”  She giggled

“Neither did I, took me a month to decide”

“That might just be a world record” She nodded genuinely impressed by his dedication to his aesthetic.

The drive from Harry’s place to Sky Garden took them about half an hour and the conversation remained light hearted the entire way but Anna couldn’t shake off the conversation she’d had with Ronnie a few days ago. It felt like the elephant in the room, and she wondered if he’d read her blog post and if he was feeling it too.  

Silence followed them through the elevator ride to the 36th floor of the walkie talkie building and into the beautiful rooftop garden. As they stepped out of the lift Harry grabbed onto Anna’s hand intertwining his fingers with hers and lead her towards the bar. Anna had never been there at this time of the day before, it was usually around midday when she came in, but right now the sun was setting over the London skyline and the room was illuminated in an orange glow.

“So do you take all your dates here?” Anna asked as they waited for the bartender

“No” Harry shook his head “been a while since I’ve been on a date”

Now Anna knew he was lying and she felt her heart sink. She knew he’d been on dates recently, she’d seen it in the papers and she couldn’t figure out why he would lie about that.

The bartender approached them and she was glad that she had an excuse to ignore his comments.

“Harry! Long time no see” he offered his hand for Harry to shake “what can I get for you?”

“Tequila on the rocks for me” he smiled and turned to Anna “what about you love?”

“Uhh” Anna thought for second “I’ll go a white wine”

“Pinot Grigio?” he asked her as he pulled a bottle from the fridge

“Please” she smiled and watched as he walked away to prepare their drinks.

“You don’t believe everything you read about me do you?” Harry asked her, sensing that she hadn’t liked his comment about dating.

“No” she shook her head “but I do believe what your crew members told me”

He nodded his head “Everybody has secrets right” he took his first sip of his drink that the bartender had just handed to him.

Anna followed him, trying to keep a positive attitude about this whole thing because she really wanted there to be a second date. He lead them to the couches in the corner of the room, that overlooked the skyline.

“I’m not” he smiled.

  1. BE     YOURSELF!

This is important. If you have to change yourself to impress the person you’re on  a date with then they’re not the right person to be dating. 2.              Wear what makes you feel your best.

If that means wearing shorts and a t-shirt then that’s what it means, if you feel confident in what you’re wearing, then you’ll feel more confident in general. Wear something that’s appropriate for what you’re doing, and if you’re as clumsy as I am, don’t wear heels, unless you want to fall flat on your face and embarrass yourself in front of your date.

3.              Don’t use your phone the whole time

If you’re going to be staring at your phone the whole time you might as well be at home. Look up, make conversation, go back to your online life when you get home.

4.              Relax

If it’s not meant to be, it’s not meant to be. Go in with a positive attitude, this could be the love of your life, but they also might not be. “Hi” She blushed.

“So, where are we going?” she asked, nerves evident in her voice.

“Well” he smirked, placing his hand over hers “ I might have hired out the sky garden for the night”

“You what?” Anna’s jaw dropped. Sky Garden had always been one Anna’s favourite places to go when she had time to kill in london. By day it was a public park and by night it was a rooftop event space but when she had looked into hiring it out for her birthday last year she was immediately turned off by the excessive holding fee and she couldn’t believe that Harry would spend that much on the first date.

“The sky garden” Harry smiled

Anna threw her head back onto the head rest and laughed “How did you manage that? It’s a Tuesday”

“I made friends with the restaurant manager a few years ago”

“So when you say you hired out the Sky Garden, you mean it’s just us there?”

“Not quite” he shook his head “It’s open to members only, but Rick said it will be quiet because it’s a Tuesday”

“And most people have real jobs” Anna added, smiling at Harry.

“How’s the blog going?” Harry turned in his seat so the he was facing Anna.

“I’ve spent the entire day in meetings about which font I should use for the header”

He began nodding his head “You’re fonting, that’s the worst kind of admin”

“I never thought I would care so much about a font”  She giggled

“Neither did I, took me a month to decide”

“That might just be a world record” She nodded genuinely impressed by his dedication to his aesthetic.

The drive from Harry’s place to Sky Garden took them about half an hour and the conversation remained light hearted the entire way but Anna couldn’t shake off the conversation she’d had with Ronnie a few days ago. It felt like the elephant in the room, and she wondered if he’d read her blog post and if he was feeling it too.  

Silence followed them through the elevator ride to the 36th floor of the walkie talkie building and into the beautiful rooftop garden. As they stepped out of the lift Harry grabbed onto Anna’s hand intertwining his fingers with hers and lead her towards the bar. Anna had never been there at this time of the day before, it was usually around midday when she came in, but right now the sun was setting over the London skyline and the room was illuminated in an orange glow.

“So do you take all your dates here?” Anna asked as they waited for the bartender

“No” Harry shook his head “been a while since I’ve been on a date”

Now Anna knew he was lying and she felt her heart sink. She knew he’d been on dates recently, she’d seen it in the papers and she couldn’t figure out why he would lie about that.

The bartender approached them and she was glad that she had an excuse to ignore his comments.

“Harry! Long time no see” he offered his hand for Harry to shake “what can I get for you?”

“Tequila on the rocks for me” he smiled and turned to Anna “what about you love?”

“Uhh” Anna thought for second “I’ll go a white wine”

“Pinot Grigio?” he asked her as he pulled a bottle from the fridge

“Please” she smiled and watched as he walked away to prepare their drinks.

“You don’t believe everything you read about me do you?” Harry asked her, sensing that she hadn’t liked his comment about dating.

“No” she shook her head “but I do believe what your crew members told me”

He nodded his head “Everybody has secrets right” he took his first sip of his drink that the bartender had just handed to him.

“So you read it then” there was a tone of bitterness in her voice.

“I’m not keeping anything from you Anna” his voice was soft and sincere but she was still having trouble believing him.

“Camille” she said sharply as she took a sip of her wine.

“Ahh” he sighed and turned around, grabbing onto her hand again “that I can explain, but let’s go sit down”

Anna followed him, trying to keep a positive attitude about this whole thing because she really wanted there to be a second date. He lead them to the couches in the corner of the room, that overlooked the skyline.

“Camille” he said as he sat down next to her “Isn’t my girlfriend, despite what everyone would like to believe, we went on one date last year, it didn’t work out, but we stayed friends”

“But she went on tour with you?” Anna was more confused than ever now

“It was a friendship with a few benefits, but it’s over now”

“Over?”

“No more benefits” Harry nodded “She wanted more and I didn’t so it only made sense to stop so that no one gets hurt”

“I’m sorry I thought you were keeping something from me”

“Don’t be “ Harry shook his head “I would have thought the same”

Anna breathed a sigh of relief. She didn’t want to believe that Harry would ever cheat on someone, but before now all the evidence was pointing towards that.

“I didn’t think you were that guy” Anna said

“I’m not” he smiled.

The conversation ended there, Anna didn’t want to ask any more questions about it, she trusted his word and she knew if he wanted to tell her more about it, he would. She took a sip of her wine and sat back in her chair, fixing her eyes on the view.

The rest of the night was filled with almosts, almost hugs, almost kisses, a lot of stolen glances and some laughter.The kind of laughter that made them cry and every time Harry would wipe the tears away from Anna’s eyes with a gentle touch . They were both treading lightly, Harry hadn’t liked a girl this much in a long time and Anna was still damaged from her last relationship. Dating again felt strange for both of them, Anna wasn’t sure she was ready to give herself to another person but getting along with Harry felt easy. She didn’t have to worry about what she looked like when she laughed, or if her hair still looked like it did when she left the house. She was comfortable and that scared her.

As the night was drawing to a close, Harry wrapped his arms around her and it turned from a night of almosts to a night of possibilities as she relaxed into his touch. The ride home didn’t seem to take as long, Anna was much more comfortable and Harry was too.  They were snuggled into each other in the back seat of the car driven by Harry’s personal driver remaining quiet, content in the other’s company.

“Comfortable silence is overrated” Anna whispered with a grin spread across her face

“Finally” Harry sighed “someone who agrees with me” and with that, he leant down and hovered his lips over hers and she was drawn in by the simple gesture caressing his lips with hers reaching her hand up to cup his face. The smell of his cologne was overpowering but in that moment Anna didn’t care, warmth flooded her as she leaned into his silken lips. They could have kissed all night, but they stopped as the car pulled up outside Anna’s flat.

“Thanks for a great night Harry” she smiled as she opened the car door

His hand was still rested on top of hers and he squeezed it gently before he started to speak “I’ll walk you inside love”

“No” Anna said as she brushed her lips against his again “if you get that far I won’t let you leave and that would be breaking my rule”

He nodded, catching her drift but placed another kiss on her lips anyway “well thank you for giving me a chance”

“How could I not?” she giggled and leant in one last time, kissing him more passionately this time

“You better go before you break your rule” he chuckled and snaked his hand around her back, opening the door for her.

“Good night Styles” she said softly as she stepped out into the brisk air.

“Anna, answer the bloody door.”

Anna stirred on the couch, not realising that she’d fallen asleep. Batting her eyelids she sat up abruptly and stretched her arms out wide, adjusting to dimming afternoon light in her apartment.

Ronnie knocked loudly on the door again. He hadn’t heard from her for a few days, which was unusual for her, normally she would send him about six texts a day but he was lucky if he got a one word response and he was worried about her.

“I’m coming” she called as she stood up “Chill.” She made her way to the door, throwing on a jumper to make herself look a little more presentable.

“What’s up Ron?”

He didn’t answer her, instead he wrapped his arms around her as if it had been months since they’d seen each other.

“I thought you were dead” he said with his head still resting on her shoulder.

“Nope” Anna giggled “Still living, I’ve just been crazy busy”

“Too busy for your best friend ay?” He was joking, Anna could tell by the tone in his voice and truth be told she had missed him.

“Never, come in, I was about to make dinner” she lied, if Ronnie didn’t knock on her door she would still be sleeping and if she was honest she didn’t even really know what the time was, but she guessed it was around 8 judging by the fading light outside.

“Mmm, what are we having?” he followed her through to the kitchen and watched as she opened the fridge which was looking mostly empty, except for a few old vegetables and a bottle of wine.

“Pizza?” Anna said closing the fridge “I haven’t had the chance to go shopping for a while”

“I can see that” Ronnie said holding up a banana that was so old it was almost black “Pizza sounds great if it means I don’t have to eat this”

“Oh come on, that would make a great banana bread”

“Yeah if it doesn’t kill you first” he put it back where he got it from and searched the drawer where Anna kept her take out menus. They ordered from their favourite restaurant and sat down with a glass of wine each, ready to catch up on what they’d missed over the last few days. Anna cleared away all the images she had lying on her dining table. Her blog was getting revamped and she had to choose the layout, which meant that she’d spent the last few days staring at different concepts.

“Geez he’s keen” Ronnie said about five minutes after they sat down as he watched Anna’s phone light up with about seven messages from Harry within the span of a minute. Anna blushed and picked her phone up.

Morning love

I know it’s not morning for you

But it’s morning here

Well kinda

It’s 4am

Time zones are weird

How are you?

“He’s in Australia” She said putting down the phone and making a mental note to reply soon.

“How did the date go?” Ronnie asked, a tone of bitterness evident in his voice.

Anna had made a point of not telling Ronnie about it, as much as she loved him, after her last relationship ended badly he got too involved in her dating life and usually scared them off.

“Well, he’s still talking to me more than a week later from the other side of the world, so I think it went ok”

“Did you kiss him? Did you fuck him? What about the other girl?” Ronnie had a habit of asking invasive questions all at once to play it off as a bit of fun, but Anna knew what he was doing.

“Ron” Anna sighed “You’re prying again”

“Answer my questions and I’ll change the subject”

“We didn’t have sex, it was the first date, you know I don’t do that” She was annoyed that he would even ask her that.

“Except for that one time that you did” Ronnie took a sip of his wine and a smug smile stretched across his face.

“That was different, I knew him well before that” She wasn’t lying. Anna had had sex with one guy on the first date, actually, she wouldn’t even call it a date, they both knew how it was going to end, it wasn’t long after she’d broken up with her dickhead of an ex boyfriend who cheated on her for months before she found out and it was a friend of hers so as far as she was concerned it didn’t count as sex on the first date, more like a friend helping out a friend.

“Ok but this is Harry Styles so maybe your standards slipped”

“If anything they’re higher, Don’t want him to think I’m easy”

“So did you kiss him then?”

“He kissed me, once, when he dropped me home” she lied again, there was more than one kiss, but Ronnie didn’t need to know that.

Ronnie nodded, holding himself back from making any comments “And the girlfriend?”

“They were friends with benefits, he says it’s over now”

“Good.”

The conversation died and Anna picked up her phone to reply to Harry, not wanting to wait  too long.

Good evening

I’m tired if I’m honest, had a long day

How are you? Got a show today?

Ronnie didn’t try to make more conversation he simply sat on Anna’s couch sipping his wine, waiting for the pizza to arrive and when it did, he was the first to make a move to answer the door.

“What’s going on with you Ron?” Anna broke the silence “any ladies?”

“You know I don’t date “ He said bluntly taking his first bite of pizza

“Alright, sorry” She rolled her eyes and picked up her buzzing phone again

Not today, making my way to Sydney for tomorrow’s show.

What’s been keeping you so busy?

Just work, revamping the blog takes time

Sydney sounds fun, I’ve always wanted to go there

The harbour’s nice, but I can’t say I’ve seen much of the city otherwise, I don’t get to go out much

I have a question for you

I might have an answer

I know it’s a lot to ask so if you don’t want to I’ll totally understand

But I really like you Anna and I want to spend more time with you, so, I was wondering if you wanted to come on tour with me in the US?

Anna read Harry’s last message and her jaw dropped causing Ronnie to look up from his own phone.

“What did he say?” he was suddenly interested again.

“He..he” Anna couldn’t quite comprehend what she’d just been asked

“He what, spit it out An”

“He wants me to go on tour with him”

Ronnie’s nostrils flared and he gently placed his plate full of pizza down on the coffee table “Anna you can’t, you just met the dude”

“It does feel sudden” she admitted, although there wasn’t a bone in her body that didn’t want to start packing her bags already.

“Yeah, because he travels with the sound guys” he said sarcastically “don’t be daft Anna, there’s no way he goes around with the crew, he’d be on private jets while they’re in economy”

“Anna, answer the bloody door.”

Anna stirred on the couch, not realising that she’d fallen asleep. Batting her eyelids she sat up abruptly and stretched her arms out wide, adjusting to dimming afternoon light in her apartment.

Ronnie knocked loudly on the door again. He hadn’t heard from her for a few days, which was unusual for her, normally she would send him about six texts a day but he was lucky if he got a one word response and he was worried about her.

“I’m coming” she called as she stood up “Chill.” She made her way to the door, throwing on a jumper to make herself look a little more presentable.

“What’s up Ron?”

He didn’t answer her, instead he wrapped his arms around her as if it had been months since they’d seen each other.

“I thought you were dead” he said with his head still resting on her shoulder.

“Nope” Anna giggled “Still living, I’ve just been crazy busy”

“Too busy for your best friend ay?” He was joking, Anna could tell by the tone in his voice and truth be told she had missed him.

“Never, come in, I was about to make dinner” she lied, if Ronnie didn’t knock on her door she would still be sleeping and if she was honest she didn’t even really know what the time was, but she guessed it was around 8 judging by the fading light outside.

“Mmm, what are we having?” he followed her through to the kitchen and watched as she opened the fridge which was looking mostly empty, except for a few old vegetables and a bottle of wine.

“Pizza?” Anna said closing the fridge “I haven’t had the chance to go shopping for a while”

“I can see that” Ronnie said holding up a banana that was so old it was almost black “Pizza sounds great if it means I don’t have to eat this”

“Oh come on, that would make a great banana bread”

“Yeah if it doesn’t kill you first” he put it back where he got it from and searched the drawer where Anna kept her take out menus. They ordered from their favourite restaurant and sat down with a glass of wine each, ready to catch up on what they’d missed over the last few days. Anna cleared away all the images she had lying on her dining table. Her blog was getting revamped and she had to choose the layout, which meant that she’d spent the last few days staring at different concepts.

“Geez he’s keen” Ronnie said about five minutes after they sat down as he watched Anna’s phone light up with about seven messages from Harry within the span of a minute. Anna blushed and picked her phone up.

Morning love

I know it’s not morning for you

But it’s morning here

Well kinda

It’s 4am

Time zones are weird

How are you?

“He’s in Australia” She said putting down the phone and making a mental note to reply soon.

“How did the date go?” Ronnie asked, a tone of bitterness evident in his voice.

Anna had made a point of not telling Ronnie about it, as much as she loved him, after her last relationship ended badly he got too involved in her dating life and usually scared them off.

“Well, he’s still talking to me more than a week later from the other side of the world, so I think it went ok”

“Did you kiss him? Did you fuck him? What about the other girl?” Ronnie had a habit of asking invasive questions all at once to play it off as a bit of fun, but Anna knew what he was doing.

“Ron” Anna sighed “You’re prying again”

“Answer my questions and I’ll change the subject”

“We didn’t have sex, it was the first date, you know I don’t do that” She was annoyed that he would even ask her that.

“Except for that one time that you did” Ronnie took a sip of his wine and a smug smile stretched across his face.

“That was different, I knew him well before that” She wasn’t lying. Anna had had sex with one guy on the first date, actually, she wouldn’t even call it a date, they both knew how it was going to end, it wasn’t long after she’d broken up with her dickhead of an ex boyfriend who cheated on her for months before she found out and it was a friend of hers so as far as she was concerned it didn’t count as sex on the first date, more like a friend helping out a friend.

“Ok but this is Harry Styles so maybe your standards slipped”

“If anything they’re higher, Don’t want him to think I’m easy”

“So did you kiss him then?”

“He kissed me, once, when he dropped me home” she lied again, there was more than one kiss, but Ronnie didn’t need to know that.

Ronnie nodded, holding himself back from making any comments “And the girlfriend?”

“They were friends with benefits, he says it’s over now”

“Good.”

The conversation died and Anna picked up her phone to reply to Harry, not wanting to wait  too long.

Good evening

I’m tired if I’m honest, had a long day

How are you? Got a show today?

Ronnie didn’t try to make more conversation he simply sat on Anna’s couch sipping his wine, waiting for the pizza to arrive and when it did, he was the first to make a move to answer the door.

“What’s going on with you Ron?” Anna broke the silence “any ladies?”

“You know I don’t date “ He said bluntly taking his first bite of pizza

“Alright, sorry” She rolled her eyes and picked up her buzzing phone again

Not today, making my way to Sydney for tomorrow’s show.

What’s been keeping you so busy?

Just work, revamping the blog takes time

Sydney sounds fun, I’ve always wanted to go there

The harbour’s nice, but I can’t say I’ve seen much of the city otherwise, I don’t get to go out much

I have a question for you

I might have an answer

I know it’s a lot to ask so if you don’t want to I’ll totally understand

But I really like you Anna and I want to spend more time with you, so, I was wondering if you wanted to come on tour with me in the US?

Anna read Harry’s last message and her jaw dropped causing Ronnie to look up from his own phone.

“What did he say?” he was suddenly interested again.

“He..he” Anna couldn’t quite comprehend what she’d just been asked

“He what, spit it out An”

“He wants me to go on tour with him”

Ronnie’s nostrils flared and he gently placed his plate full of pizza down on the coffee table “Anna you can’t, you just met the dude”

“It does feel sudden” she admitted, although there wasn’t a bone in her body that didn’t want to start packing her bags already.

“Sudden!” Ronnie exclaimed “it’s mental, you’ve been on one date”

“It’s not like I’d be travelling with just him, you saw how big his crew is”

“Yeah, because he travels with the sound guys” he said sarcastically “don’t be daft Anna, there’s no way he goes around with the crew, he’d be on private jets while they’re in economy”

“Look I don’t know if he does that or not, but it’s beside the point. I’ve got nothing to lose at this point Ronnie, if I go with him and it works out then great, but if it doesn’t then fine, at least I’ll have interesting content for my blog”

“Whatever Anna” he said standing up from his seat and making his way towards the door “but don’t ignore me for months and expect me to pick up the pieces when he breaks your heart” he slammed the door shut and left Anna standing there in silence. She was used to this from Ronnie, he overreacted all the time he would calm down by tomorrow morning and send her an apologetic message followed by a request to pick up his jacket on his way home from work. If she had even the slightest doubts about going on tour with Harry what Ronnie had just said would have been enough to convince her not to go. But she had no doubts, sure, she had only been on one date with him, but she had a good feeling about it and he wouldn’t have asked if he didn’t want her there. So, she picked up her phone again and took a deep breath as she replied to Harry’s message.

I’d love to. x.
trail.content_abstract:
I’m sorry that this took so long, life took over for a little while, but I’m hoping to have the next one out reasonably soon, before time gets away from me again. Let me know your thoughts on this chapter and what you think might happen next. 

Master Post 

April 17th.

My First Date Tips

  1. BE     YOURSELF!

This is important. If you have to change yourself to impress the person you’re on  a date with then they’re not the right person to be dating. Don’t pretend to like music you don’t, or shy away from sharing your interests because you’re afraid they won’t like them. If you have to pretend to be someone you’re not on the first date, the second and third probably aren’t going to go so well.

2.              Wear what makes you feel your best.

If that means wearing shorts and a t-shirt then that’s what it means, if you feel confident in what you’re wearing, then you’ll feel more confident in general. Wear something that’s appropriate for what you’re doing, and if you’re as clumsy as I am, don’t wear heels, unless you want to fall flat on your face and embarrass yourself in front of your date.

3.              Don’t use your phone the whole time

If you’re going to be staring at your phone the whole time you might as well be at home. Look up, make conversation, go back to your online life when you get home.

4.              Relax

This isn’t a job interview, your date is probably just as nervous, take a few deep breaths and relax into yourself. It’s natural to feel feel nervous but just remember not to put too much pressure on yourself, this is a first date, if you don’t like them you can leave, it’s not the end of the world.

5.              Don’t force it

If it’s not meant to be, it’s not meant to be. Go in with a positive attitude, this could be the love of your life, but they also might not be. Don’t go in thinking it’s going to be terrible, but don’t put too much pressure on you or your date, take it one step at a time, focus on the date and try to enjoy yourself, but if you don’t, it’s no big deal. There are plenty of other fish in the sea.

That dating game is brutal, I’ve been on my fair share of first dates over the years, some of them wonderful, some of them horrible, all of them learning experiences, but watch me ignore all of my own advice when I go on a date tonight. Wish me luck!

Anna. x
